intro: Melilotoides ruthenica var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed melilot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in racemes, and bloom in early summer. The species is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
